DataElement.preferredName: Excision Sentinel Lymph Node With Primary Neoplasm Excision Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to signify whether a sentinel lymph node was removed at the same time as the primary tumor.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Excision Sentinel Lymph Node With Primary Neoplasm Excision
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ._The first lymph node to which cancer is likely to spread from the primary tumor. Cancer cells may appear first in the sentinel node before spreading to other lymph nodes._Used to indicate the presence of something or someone._A tumor at the original site of origin._The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ.:The first lymph node to which cancer is likely to spread from the primary tumor. Cancer cells may appear first in the sentinel node before spreading to other lymph nodes.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

The first lymph node that is affected by cancer spread from the primary site.  Sentinel lymph node biopsy is part of the staging work-up to determine early metastasis to regional lymph nodes in patients with breast carcinoma or melanoma.

Property.preferredDefinition: Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.:A tumor at the original site of origin.:The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ.

Concepts.definition: Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.
A tumor at the original site of origin.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.
